Expectation1: Collaborate with other teams to define and design new features
Situation1: Design documents are due soon and other teams are waiting for their technical input
Expectation2: Organize and lead religious education classes for children and adults
Situation2: The regular weekly religious education class for the parish's children is scheduled.
Story: I stared at my laptop, the cursor blinking accusingly on the half-finished design document. Slack notifications pinged relentlessly—product managers and designers from other teams needed my technical input before they could move forward. The deadline was tomorrow, and I knew everyone was waiting on me. My phone buzzed with a calendar reminder: the children’s religious education class was in an hour. I was supposed to organize the lesson, set up the classroom, and lead the session. Parents and kids would be arriving soon, expecting guidance and warmth. My mind raced, torn between the urgent demands of my team and the spiritual needs of my parish. I felt the weight of both worlds pressing in, each expecting my full presence, each unwilling to wait. My heart pounded as I sat frozen, unable to choose which part of myself to let down.
